origin:
Even billionaires are acknowledging it, folks.

When 40% of Americans can‚Äôt afford basic needs, or a $400 emergency, the problem isn‚Äôt unique. It‚Äôs systemic.

That‚Äôs not good for anyone. Even billionaires know they can‚Äôt shield themselves from this kind of perilous instability. https://twitter.com/CNBC/status/1104933726432186368¬†‚Ä¶
"Capitalism basically is not working for the majority of people," hedge fund billionaire Ray Dalio says.  https://cnb.cx/2TBJmui¬†

This is why we advocate for:
- Medicare for All
- Tuition-free public college
- Investing in dignified jobs that build our nation + get us to 100% renewables before it‚Äôs too late.

These are investments in people, not profits. Corps aren‚Äôt incentivized to ensure people‚Äôs health.
And this isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúsocialistic idea.‚Äù It‚Äôs a humanitarian idea.
Capitalism doesn‚Äôt work for most of us because of the greed of so many of the others, the top 1%. Why must capitalism be so unbalanced? How does one legislate against greed? Questions to ponder.
Capitalism works under individualism, if you don‚Äôt try you don‚Äôt succeed.
